name: Customer Account Data
description: Master data for 81,000+ customer accounts across 120 countries, including organization profiles, account identifiers, service subscriptions, customer tier classifications (Managed, Dedicated, Public Cloud), and account lifecycle status. Covers both direct enterprise customers and channel partner accounts within Public Cloud ($1,683M FY2024) and Private Cloud ($1,055M FY2024) business units. Managed via the Customer Management Service (CMS) and MyRackspace portal. Subject to GDPR, CCPA (California Consumer Privacy Act — Consumer Privacy Protection Addendum published), LGPD, and equivalent national privacy laws given 120-country customer footprint. Sourced from FY2024 10-K, Rackspace Privacy Notice, and CCPA Consumer Privacy Protection Addendum.

retention_policy.minimum_retention: Duration of customer relationship
retention_policy.minimum_retention_basis: Business necessity and service delivery obligation; CCPA requires acknowledgment of deletion requests within 45 days of account closure
retention_policy.maximum_retention: 7 years post-account closure
retention_policy.maximum_retention_basis: Tax, accounting, and legal dispute resolution obligations; consistent with Rackspace Privacy Notice principle of retaining only as long as necessary plus applicable legal periods
retention_policy.destruction_method: Secure digital deletion with certificate of destruction; anonymization where full deletion is not feasible
retention_policy.legal_hold_status: No active enterprise-wide legal hold; individual accounts subject to hold per litigation requirements

name: Revenue and Billing Data
description: Financial transaction data supporting $2.7B annual revenue across Public Cloud ($1,683M) and Private Cloud ($1,055M) segments plus Data Center Services. Encompasses invoice generation, payment processing, revenue recognition records, deferred revenue schedules, accounts receivable (including Rackspace Receivables LLC special purpose entity used for AR securitization), usage metering, and chargeback data. Processed through SAP S/4HANA financial system and Rackspace Fabric billing data store. Linked to PCI DSS Level 1 Service Provider certified infrastructure for cardholder payment processing. Subject to SOX Section 404 internal controls over financial reporting as a public company. Sourced from FY2024 10-K, Q4 2024 earnings call, and Rackspace Fabric billing documentation.

retention_policy.minimum_retention: 7 years
retention_policy.minimum_retention_basis: IRS tax records retention (26 U.S.C. § 6501), GAAP audit trail requirements, SOX Section 404 documentation; PCI DSS Requirement 10.7 audit log retention minimum 1 year with 3 months immediately available
retention_policy.maximum_retention: 10 years
retention_policy.maximum_retention_basis: Statute of limitations for tax fraud (6 years), extended for complex financial disputes; SEC Rule 17a-4 financial records standards as publicly traded company (NASDAQ: RXT)
retention_policy.destruction_method: Secure digital deletion with auditor certification; no destruction while SOX audit trails are active
retention_policy.legal_hold_status: Subject to litigation hold related to Apollo Global Management leveraged buyout debt structure disputes and ongoing securities class action matters

name: Employee and Workforce Data
description: Human resources records for approximately 6,500 employees (Rackers) globally across 50+ countries, managed through the Global People System (GPS) powered by Workday HCM. Includes employee profiles, compensation records, performance evaluations, leave and attendance records, benefits enrollment, payroll data, tax withholding forms (W-2, Form 1099), employment contracts, background check results, I-9 employment eligibility verification records, and termination documentation. Multi-jurisdictional workforce spans US (Texas HQ), UK, Netherlands, Germany, Switzerland, India, Egypt, Mexico, Australia, Singapore, Hong Kong, and other locations, triggering overlapping employment data protection obligations including GDPR (EU), UK GDPR, PIPL (China), PDPA (India), and state-level US employment law. EEO-1 reporting data included. Sourced from FY2024 10-K, Workday partnership announcements, and global employment compliance disclosures.

retention_policy.minimum_retention: 7 years after employment termination
retention_policy.minimum_retention_basis: FLSA record retention (29 CFR 516.5), EEOC charge filing statute of limitations, I-9 retention (3 years from hire or 1 year from termination, whichever is later), W-2 IRS retention; GDPR Article 5(1)(e) storage limitation principle applied per jurisdiction
retention_policy.maximum_retention: 10 years after employment termination
retention_policy.maximum_retention_basis: Extended for pension/benefits claims, complex employment litigation (statute of limitations varies by jurisdiction up to 10 years in some EU jurisdictions), and executive compensation clawback documentation under Dodd-Frank
retention_policy.destruction_method: Secure digital deletion or anonymization per jurisdiction-specific requirements; Workday HCM automated retention enforcement where configured
retention_policy.legal_hold_status: No enterprise-wide active hold; individual records subject to hold per EEOC charges, employment litigation, or immigration proceedings

name: Sales and Pipeline Data
description: Commercial data generated by 400+ quota-bearing sales representatives and customer success managers, including opportunity pipeline data, CRM account records, contact data for procurement decision-makers and IT leaders at enterprise accounts, sales forecasts, deal registration records, partner deal registrations, win/loss analysis, and sales compensation calculations. Managed through Salesforce CRM (da-099) and integrated with Rackspace Fabric for account-level cross-sell propensity scoring. Sales bookings grew +22% YoY for Public Cloud in FY2024; total FY2024 bookings +14% YoY. Data services bookings >2x FY2024. Subject to CCPA and GDPR as contact-level personal data for business buyers is often covered by privacy law. Sourced from FY2024 10-K, Q4 2024 earnings call, and Salesforce CRM partnership documentation.

retention_policy.minimum_retention: 3 years post-opportunity close
retention_policy.minimum_retention_basis: Sales commission dispute resolution period; CRM data housekeeping best practice; CCPA right to deletion applies to individual contact data on request
retention_policy.maximum_retention: 7 years
retention_policy.maximum_retention_basis: Contract disputes and revenue recognition audit trail (SOX); customer relationship continuity for enterprise accounts with multi-year renewal cycles
retention_policy.destruction_method: Salesforce record deletion with cascading archive purge; anonymization of contact-level PII for analytics retention
retention_policy.legal_hold_status: No active hold at enterprise level; individual records subject to hold per commercial disputes

name: Contract and Legal Agreement Data
description: Master services agreements, service orders, statements of work, non-disclosure agreements, business associate agreements (BAAs for HIPAA-covered customers), data processing addenda (incorporating GDPR Standard Contractual Clauses), government contract vehicles (SEWP V Contract GS-35F-0264Y, GSA MAS Schedule), vendor agreements, and partner agreements. Includes SEWP V (ctr-027), GSA MAS (ctr-026), Carahsoft GSA partnership, Microsoft Azure Expert MSP (ctr-029), AWS Strategic Collaboration Agreement (Oct 2024), and Palantir AIP partnership (ctr-018). Legal agreements govern $2.7B+ in annual revenue. BAAs mandatory for HIPAA-covered healthcare customers (HITRUST certified environment). DPA incorporates SCCs (EU Commission Decision 2021/914) for cross-border transfers. Sourced from FY2024 10-K, government contract award databases (USASpending.gov), and Rackspace legal documentation.

retention_policy.minimum_retention: Contract term plus 7 years after expiration
retention_policy.minimum_retention_basis: Contract law statute of limitations (UCC Article 2: 4 years; written contracts: 6-10 years depending on jurisdiction); SOX audit requirements for revenue-impacting contracts; government contract retention requirements (FAR 4.703: 3 years, CMMC 3 years)
retention_policy.maximum_retention: Contract term plus 10 years
retention_policy.maximum_retention_basis: Complex commercial disputes, government contract audit rights (FAR 52.215-2 allows audit up to 3 years post-final payment); DOJ/FTC merger review records for Apollo acquisition documentation
retention_policy.destruction_method: Secure deletion with legal department certification; government contracts require National Archives disposition authority
retention_policy.legal_hold_status: Active hold on Hosted Exchange breach-related MSA documentation and customer class action litigation; hold on Apollo LBO transaction documents

name: Intellectual Property Data
description: Registered and unregistered trademarks including Rackspace, Rackspace Technology, Fanatical, Fanatical Experience, Rackspace Fabric, RAISE, MyRackspace, RackConnect, Logbook, and OpenStack contributions. Patent portfolio covering cloud management technologies, infrastructure automation, and managed services delivery methods. Trade secrets encompassing proprietary pricing models, customer churn prediction algorithms, multi-cloud management tooling source code, AIDE platform architecture, FAIR practice methodology (Ideate, Incubate, Industrialize), and OpenStack Flex (Genestack-based) deployment blueprints. Source code repositories maintained in GitLab (da-078). Rackspace is a registered trademark in the United States and numerous international jurisdictions. OpenStack contributions are open-sourced under Apache 2.0 license. AIDE platform commercialized at AWS re:Invent 2023 and Microsoft Ignite 2023. Sourced from USPTO trademark registrations, FY2024 10-K IP section, and Rackspace open source governance disclosures.

retention_policy.minimum_retention: Perpetual for registered IP; 7 years for expired/abandoned IP
retention_policy.minimum_retention_basis: Trademark rights persist as long as mark is in use and maintained; patent rights 20 years from filing; trade secret protection permanent if secrecy maintained; Lanham Act recordkeeping
retention_policy.maximum_retention: Perpetual
retention_policy.maximum_retention_basis: Active business IP requires indefinite retention; abandoned trademarks retained 7 years for priority dispute resolution
retention_policy.destruction_method: No routine destruction; formal IP abandonment process with USPTO for deregistered marks
retention_policy.legal_hold_status: No active holds; routine IP enforcement monitoring in place

name: SEC Financial Reporting Data
description: Structured financial data underlying 10-K annual reports, 10-Q quarterly reports, 8-K current reports, DEF 14A proxy statements, and Form 4 insider transaction filings submitted to the SEC under EDGAR for Rackspace Technology Inc. (NASDAQ: RXT). Includes segment revenue disclosures for Public Cloud ($1,683M FY2024, -3% YoY) and Private Cloud ($1,055M FY2024, -13% YoY), non-GAAP reconciliation schedules, restructuring charges (Project Eagle), goodwill and intangible asset impairment disclosures, debt covenant compliance metrics (FLSO/FLFO term loan facilities, $550M senior secured notes), and share-based compensation tables. Prepared under US GAAP; audited by Deloitte. Quarterly earnings supplementals filed via 8-K. Sourced from SEC EDGAR filings, Q4 2024 and Q3 2025 earnings releases, and Rackspace investor relations disclosures.

retention_policy.minimum_retention: 7 years
retention_policy.minimum_retention_basis: SOX Section 802 — destruction of corporate audit records criminal penalty; SEC Rule 17a-4 broker-dealer records; IRS six-year statute of limitations for substantial understatement of income
retention_policy.maximum_retention: Permanent
retention_policy.maximum_retention_basis: Public company filings are permanently archived in SEC EDGAR and must be accessible to shareholders and regulators indefinitely; historical financial records support M&A due diligence and ongoing litigation
retention_policy.destruction_method: No routine destruction of SEC filed documents; internal working papers: 7 years then secure deletion with CFO certification
retention_policy.legal_hold_status: Subject to ongoing securities litigation hold and Apollo LBO leveraged capital structure review documentation requirements

name: Accounting and General Ledger Data
description: US GAAP financial records including chart of accounts, journal entries, accounts receivable (including Rackspace Receivables LLC AR securitization program), accounts payable, general ledger closing entries, intercompany eliminations, fixed asset registers, depreciation schedules, and financial period close documentation. Managed through SAP S/4HANA ERP. Supports $2.7B annual revenue across 50+ legal entities in multiple currencies. Intercompany transactions among Rackspace Technology Inc., Rackspace Technology Global Inc. (UK subsidiary), and 50+ international entities. Transfer pricing documentation included. Supports SOX Section 404 management assessment of ICFR. External audit performed by Deloitte & Touche LLP. Sourced from FY2024 10-K, SAP ERP system documentation, and Rackspace treasury disclosures.

retention_policy.minimum_retention: 7 years
retention_policy.minimum_retention_basis: IRS Publication 583 (business records 7 years minimum); GAAP audit evidence retention; SOX Section 802 (criminal penalty for destruction of audit records within 7-year SOX preservation period)
retention_policy.maximum_retention: 10 years
retention_policy.maximum_retention_basis: Complex multi-jurisdictional tax audits (some jurisdictions require 10-year retention); transfer pricing documentation (OECD BEPS Action 13 three-tier documentation maintained 5 years minimum); M&A due diligence access periods
retention_policy.destruction_method: Secure deletion following CFO sign-off and external auditor confirmation of audit cycle closure; SAP archiving to cold storage after 7 years
retention_policy.legal_hold_status: No active holds on routine GL data; Apollo LBO-related transaction records under hold

name: Debt Instrument and Treasury Data
description: Capital structure data including FLSO Term Loan Facility, FLFO Term Loan Facility, 3.50% FLSO Senior Secured Notes, 5.375% Senior Notes, New Revolving Credit Facility ($375M), interest rate swap portfolio (eight active swaps), and SOFR-based variable rate calculations from the March 2024 refinancing transactions.

retention_policy.minimum_retention: 7 years
retention_policy.minimum_retention_basis: SOX Section 802; SEC Rule 17a-4 for issuer records; IRS retention for debt-related instruments
retention_policy.maximum_retention: Permanent for filed SEC instruments; 10 years for internal treasury models
retention_policy.maximum_retention_basis: SEC EDGAR permanent filing record; prudent business practice for capital structure history
retention_policy.destruction_method: Secure deletion with certificate of destruction for non-public portions; public filings exempt from destruction
retention_policy.legal_hold_status: Active — Apollo Global Management LBO closing documents and March 2024 refinancing under ongoing review

name: Insider and Equity Compensation Data
description: Form 4 insider transaction filings, Section 16 officer/director equity holdings, 2020 Equity Incentive Plan grant and vesting data, restricted stock unit allocations, performance stock unit metrics, long-term incentive cash unit awards, and Employee Stock Purchase Plan participation records.

retention_policy.minimum_retention: 7 years post-vesting or termination
retention_policy.minimum_retention_basis: SEC Rule 17a-4 for Form 4 / Section 16 filings; IRS for equity compensation tax records; SOX for equity plan administration
retention_policy.maximum_retention: 7 years post-termination of equity plan or individual participation
retention_policy.maximum_retention_basis: IRS statute of limitations (6 years); SOX 7-year audit trail requirement
retention_policy.destruction_method: Secure deletion; SEC-filed Form 4s are permanent public record and exempt from internal destruction
retention_policy.legal_hold_status: Active — Section 16 insider records subject to securities litigation hold

name: Customer-Hosted Cloud Workload Data
description: Data stored, processed, and transmitted by customers within Rackspace-managed cloud infrastructure across public cloud (AWS, Azure, Google Cloud) and private cloud (VMware, OpenStack) environments, for which Rackspace acts as data processor under the Customer Data Processing Addendum with limited knowledge of contents.

retention_policy.minimum_retention: Duration of service contract
retention_policy.minimum_retention_basis: Customer Data Processing Addendum (DPA); GDPR Article 28 processor obligations; contractual SLA commitments
retention_policy.maximum_retention: 30 days post-contract termination for customer-initiated deletion; Rackspace retains no copies beyond wind-down period
retention_policy.maximum_retention_basis: DPA termination clause; GDPR Article 28(3)(g) — processor must delete or return data at controller's request
retention_policy.destruction_method: NIST 800-88 media sanitization; cryptographic erasure for cloud storage; certificate of destruction provided to customer on request
retention_policy.legal_hold_status: Active for customers involved in December 2022 Hosted Exchange incident litigation

name: Customer Email and Collaboration Data
description: Email messages, attachments, calendar entries, and contact records hosted via Rackspace Email, Hosted Exchange (impacted by December 2022 ransomware incident), and Microsoft 365 managed services, including mailbox data migrated to Microsoft Exchange Plan 1 during incident remediation.

retention_policy.minimum_retention: Duration of hosted email service contract
retention_policy.minimum_retention_basis: Customer DPA; GDPR Article 28 processor obligations; email service SLA
retention_policy.maximum_retention: Contract term plus 90 days wind-down; PST archives retained indefinitely pending breach litigation resolution
retention_policy.maximum_retention_basis: Breach litigation legal hold — Play ransomware incident (November/December 2022) accessed PST archives of approximately 27 of 30,000 Hosted Exchange customers; data cannot be destroyed pending litigation
retention_policy.destruction_method: Cryptographic erasure and NIST 800-88 sanitization; breach-implicated PST archives exempt from destruction pending legal hold release
retention_policy.legal_hold_status: Active — December 2022 Play ransomware breach; customer class action and regulatory investigation ongoing

name: Customer Database and Application Data
description: Relational and non-relational database contents managed by Rackspace database administration services across Oracle, Microsoft SQL Server, MySQL, PostgreSQL, MongoDB, Elasticsearch, and Redis platforms, including Database-as-a-Service provisioning metadata and performance tuning configurations.

retention_policy.minimum_retention: Duration of managed database service contract
retention_policy.minimum_retention_basis: Customer DPA; GDPR Article 28; contractual SLA — Rackspace acts as processor with no independent data right
retention_policy.maximum_retention: 30–90 days post-termination depending on customer wind-down instructions; backups purged per backup schedule agreed in SLA
retention_policy.maximum_retention_basis: DPA termination provisions; GDPR Article 28(3)(g); NIST SP 800-53 media protection controls
retention_policy.destruction_method: NIST 800-88 cryptographic erasure and degaussing for physical media; logical deletion with audit log for cloud-based database services
retention_policy.legal_hold_status: None enterprise-wide; individual customer databases subject to their own legal hold obligations communicated via DPA

name: Customer Data Lake and Warehouse Data
description: Structured, semi-structured, and unstructured data aggregated in customer data lake and data warehouse environments, including Snowflake Data Cloud deployments, Amazon Redshift, Azure Synapse Analytics, and Google BigQuery implementations managed through Rackspace DataOps and data modernization services.

retention_policy.minimum_retention: Duration of DataOps or data modernization service contract
retention_policy.minimum_retention_basis: Customer DPA; GDPR Article 28; cloud provider SLA (Snowflake, AWS, Azure, Google)
retention_policy.maximum_retention: 30 days post-termination; customer-defined archival tiers govern long-term cold storage within customer-controlled buckets
retention_policy.maximum_retention_basis: DPA termination clause; customer retains data controller rights and sets archival policy; Rackspace is processor only
retention_policy.destruction_method: Cryptographic erasure of encryption keys (AWS KMS, Azure Key Vault, GCP KMS); logical deletion of managed service metadata; certificate of destruction on request
retention_policy.legal_hold_status: None — customer is data controller and manages own legal holds; Rackspace to cooperate per DPA Article 7

name: Personal Information (Privacy-Regulated Data)
description: Personally identifiable information collected as data controller per the Rackspace Privacy Notice (revised September 2024), encompassing CCPA-defined categories: personal contact information, demographic data, identifiers (IP address, device ID, unique identifiers), commercial/financial information, internet activity data, and inferred geolocation data from website visitors, job applicants, and business contacts.

retention_policy.minimum_retention: Duration of business relationship or legal basis
retention_policy.minimum_retention_basis: GDPR Article 5(1)(e) — storage limitation; CCPA consumer rights obligations; Rackspace Privacy Notice (September 2024 revision) — retained as long as reasonably necessary for stated purposes
retention_policy.maximum_retention: 3 years from last interaction for marketing/website visitors; 7 years for commercial transaction records; immediate upon verified CCPA/GDPR deletion request (where no competing legal basis)
retention_policy.maximum_retention_basis: GDPR data minimization principle; CCPA right to deletion (Section 1798.105); Privacy Notice commitment to reasonable retention; GDPR Recital 65
retention_policy.destruction_method: Secure deletion from CRM (Salesforce) and marketing automation systems; anonymization as alternative to deletion where legally permitted; subprocessor deletion instructions issued per GDPR Article 28(3)(g)
retention_policy.legal_hold_status: None standard; individual consumer deletion requests processed within 45 days per CCPA; GDPR erasure requests processed within 30 days

name: Cardholder Data Environment
description: Payment card data processed within PCI DSS Level 1 Service Provider certified infrastructure, including primary account numbers (PAN), cardholder names, expiration dates, service codes, and sensitive authentication data across US, UK, Hong Kong, and Australia facilities, governed by the PCI Responsibility Matrix and annual Reports on Compliance.

retention_policy.minimum_retention: 1 year for transaction logs; 3 years for QSA Reports on Compliance
retention_policy.minimum_retention_basis: PCI DSS v4.0 Requirement 10.7 — audit log retention minimum 12 months; PCI DSS Requirement 12.3.2 — ROC/SAQ retained minimum 3 years; Rackspace Level 1 Service Provider obligations
retention_policy.maximum_retention: 1 year for SAD (sensitive authentication data must NOT be retained post-authorization); PAN retained only as long as business need justified with compensating controls
retention_policy.maximum_retention_basis: PCI DSS v4.0 Requirement 3.2.1 — SAD must not be stored after authorization; Requirement 3.3 — PAN must be rendered unreadable or masked; scope reduction drives minimization
retention_policy.destruction_method: NIST 800-88 cryptographic erasure; magnetic degaussing for physical media; quarterly data minimization review with PCI QSA oversight; destruction logged in cardholder data inventory
retention_policy.legal_hold_status: None — PCI DSS scope maintained through quarterly scans and annual QSA assessment; no active litigation requiring CDE hold

name: Protected Health Information
description: Electronic protected health information (ePHI) processed within HITRUST CSF-certified dedicated hosting environments under executed Business Associate Agreements, including patient identifiers, medical record numbers, health plan beneficiary numbers, and biometric identifiers as defined by HIPAA, supporting Rackspace's healthcare vertical strategy.

retention_policy.minimum_retention: 6 years from creation or last effective date of BAA
retention_policy.minimum_retention_basis: HIPAA 45 CFR § 164.532 — Business Associate Agreement records retained minimum 6 years; HIPAA Privacy Rule § 164.530(j) — covered entity policies and procedures 6 years; HITRUST CSF Requirement 07.a
retention_policy.maximum_retention: 6 years from date of creation or last effective date; ePHI for minors retained until age of majority plus 3 years or 6 years from creation, whichever is longer
retention_policy.maximum_retention_basis: HIPAA data minimization principles; BAA termination provisions require return or destruction of ePHI upon contract end; state medical records laws may extend beyond HIPAA floor
retention_policy.destruction_method: NIST 800-88 cryptographic erasure and secure overwrite; physical media degaussing; BAA-required destruction certification provided to covered entity customer
retention_policy.legal_hold_status: None enterprise-wide; individual BAA customers may impose holds — Rackspace obligated to cooperate per HIPAA BAA terms

name: Controlled Unclassified Information
description: Federal government data processed within FedRAMP Moderate JAB-authorized Rackspace Government Cloud on VMware, including CUI categories, DoD Impact Level 2 and IL4 classified workloads, FISMA-regulated information systems data, and IRS Publication 1075 tax information for federal cabinet agencies.

retention_policy.minimum_retention: 3 years (FedRAMP/FISMA); 5 years for IRS Pub 1075 tax information records
retention_policy.minimum_retention_basis: FedRAMP JAB Authorization records minimum 3 years; FISMA NIST SP 800-53 AU-11 requires minimum 3-year audit record retention; IRS Publication 1075 Section 4.7 — FTI records 5 years; DFARS 252.204-7012 cyber incident records 3 years
retention_policy.maximum_retention: 3 years post-authorization expiration; 5 years for IRS FTI-related records; CUI records retained per originating agency disposition schedule
retention_policy.maximum_retention_basis: NARA disposition schedules for federal record types; FedRAMP Moderate Continuous Monitoring requirement; 32 CFR Part 2002 CUI destruction standards
retention_policy.destruction_method: NSA/CSS EPL-listed media destruction for classified residue; NIST 800-88 for unclassified CUI; destruction witnessed and documented per DFARS and FedRAMP requirements; certificates of destruction to agency customers
retention_policy.legal_hold_status: None — subject to agency-specific legal holds communicated via GSA contract vehicles; Rackspace Government Cloud maintains 24/7 COOP capabilities

name: ITAR-Controlled Technical Data
description: International Traffic in Arms Regulations-controlled technical data and defense articles processed within ITAR-compliant hosting environments for defense industrial base customers, subject to export control restrictions and DFARS 252.204-7012 safeguarding requirements with NIST SP 800-171 control baseline.

retention_policy.minimum_retention: 5 years for export license and compliance records; 3 years for DFARS cyber incident records
retention_policy.minimum_retention_basis: ITAR 22 CFR Part 127.12 — export license records and supporting documentation minimum 5 years; DFARS 252.204-7012(m) — cyber incident records 3 years from date of incident; EAR 15 CFR Part 762 — 5 years for export-controlled records
retention_policy.maximum_retention: 5 years from date of export or license expiration; technical data subject to ITAR indefinitely if no license expiration
retention_policy.maximum_retention_basis: ITAR 22 CFR Part 120.6 — defense technical data classification does not expire; prudent practice retains for duration of defense article lifecycle; contract completion plus 7 years for DCAA audit purposes
retention_policy.destruction_method: DoD 5220.22-M compliant media sanitization; physical destruction of storage media for classified residue; NSA-approved degaussing; destruction certified and reported per ITAR compliance officer sign-off
retention_policy.legal_hold_status: None — ITAR compliance program under VP Government Cloud Services; DDTC voluntary disclosure protocol in place if required

name: Cross-Border Transfer Data
description: Personal data transferred across national boundaries under EU Standard Contractual Clauses, UK International Data Transfer Addendum, APEC Cross-Border Privacy Rules, and Intragroup Data Processing Addendum, involving Rackspace Germany GmbH (EU representative), Rackspace Limited (UK representative), and Rackspace International GmbH (Switzerland representative).

retention_policy.minimum_retention: Duration of data transfer plus 3 years for SCC and transfer records
retention_policy.minimum_retention_basis: GDPR Article 30 — records of processing activities maintained while processing continues; EU Commission Decision 2021/914 SCC Module requirements — records of transfers and TIAs retained minimum 3 years post-transfer; UK IDTA Addendum and APEC CBPR certification records 3 years
retention_policy.maximum_retention: Transfer impact assessments: 3 years post-transfer expiry; Intragroup DPA schedules: 3 years after termination; GDPR Article 30 RoPA: ongoing while processing continues
retention_policy.maximum_retention_basis: GDPR accountability principle (Article 5(2)); ICO guidance on international transfers documentation; Swiss FDPIC guidance on SCC equivalents for Swiss transfers via Rackspace International GmbH
retention_policy.destruction_method: Secure deletion of transfer records and TIA documentation; anonymization of personal data transferred after retention expires; Rackspace Germany GmbH EU representative responsible for coordinating GDPR erasure requests from EU data subjects
retention_policy.legal_hold_status: None — SCCs incorporate Commission Decision 2021/914; Schrems II TIA completed and on file; APEC CBPR certification current

name: Security Event and Log Data
description: Aggregated security telemetry from Splunk SIEM platform, including authentication logs from Active Directory (Corporate, Intensive, Global RS directories), Cisco ACS network device authentication events, ADFS federation events, endpoint protection alerts, and failed login attempt monitoring data across enterprise and customer-facing infrastructure.

retention_policy.minimum_retention: 1 year online; 3 years total for security event logs
retention_policy.minimum_retention_basis: PCI DSS v4.0 Requirement 10.7 — 12 months minimum log retention; NIST SP 800-53 AU-11 — 3-year total retention (1 year immediately accessible); FedRAMP Moderate requirement; HIPAA Security Rule § 164.312(b) — 6 years for audit log policy; SOX Section 802 — 7 years for audit trails supporting financial reporting controls
retention_policy.maximum_retention: 7 years for SOX-relevant authentication and change audit trails; 6 years for HIPAA-scope log data; breach-related logs retained indefinitely pending legal hold release
retention_policy.maximum_retention_basis: SOX 7-year audit record requirement overrides shorter regulatory floors; legal hold on December 2022 breach-related Splunk data and AD authentication logs prevents destruction; Rackspace litigation preservation obligations
retention_policy.destruction_method: Secure deletion from Splunk with cryptographic verification; breach-implicated log archives exempt from scheduled destruction pending legal hold release by GC
retention_policy.legal_hold_status: Active — December 2022 Play ransomware breach; Splunk authentication logs and AD event data identified as material evidence in customer class action and regulatory investigation

name: Identity and Access Management Data
description: Directory services and identity governance data across three Active Directory architectures (Corporate AD for employees, Intensive AD for customer access, Global RS AD for customer accounts), SailPoint IdentityIQ governance policies, role-based access control definitions, privileged access management records, and organizational unit segregation configurations.

retention_policy.minimum_retention: 7 years for access provisioning and deprovisioning records
retention_policy.minimum_retention_basis: SOX Section 404 — access control audit trail required for IT general controls; PCI DSS v4.0 Requirement 8.3 — user access record retention 1 year minimum; NIST SP 800-53 AC-2 account management; SailPoint IIQ governance audit records — 7 years per internal policy
retention_policy.maximum_retention: Lifetime of account plus 7 years post-termination for employee identity records; PAM session recordings: 90 days to 7 years by access tier and compliance scope; Privileged access records for SOX controls: 7 years
retention_policy.maximum_retention_basis: SOX 7-year ITGC requirement; GDPR Article 17 erasure balanced against SOX retention obligation for corporate employees; former employee access records needed for audit defense
retention_policy.destruction_method: SailPoint IIQ automated deprovisioning workflow with audit trail; AD account disable-then-delete cycle per joiner-mover-leaver process; PAM recording purge per tier-based retention schedule; cryptographic erasure for deleted credentials
retention_policy.legal_hold_status: Active — December 2022 breach investigation; Corporate AD, Intensive AD, and Global RS AD access logs are material evidence; SailPoint governance records subpoenaed in regulatory proceedings

name: Vulnerability and Threat Intelligence Data
description: Vulnerability assessment scan results, penetration testing reports, threat intelligence feeds, cybersecurity incident investigation records, and security advisory data maintained by the cybersecurity team under the CSO who has 20+ years of information security leadership experience and reports to the President of AI, Technology and Sustainability.

retention_policy.minimum_retention: 1 year for vulnerability scan results; 3 years for penetration test reports and incident investigation records
retention_policy.minimum_retention_basis: PCI DSS v4.0 Requirement 11.3 — internal and external vulnerability scan results retained minimum 1 year; NIST SP 800-53 CA-8 — pentest documentation 3 years; FedRAMP Continuous Monitoring — vulnerability data 3 years; DFARS 252.204-7012 — cyber incident investigation records 3 years
retention_policy.maximum_retention: 3 years for routine scan results; 7 years for breach-related investigation records; threat intelligence feeds: 2 years active plus 3 years archive
retention_policy.maximum_retention_basis: SOX audit defense for security controls; breach litigation preservation obligation; FedRAMP 3-year ATO record retention; PCI QSA report chain-of-custody requirements
retention_policy.destruction_method: Secure deletion with access-controlled destruction authorization; pentest reports require CISO sign-off before destruction; breach investigation records exempt from scheduled destruction pending legal hold release
retention_policy.legal_hold_status: Active — December 2022 Play ransomware incident; penetration test reports, vulnerability assessments, and threat intelligence contemporaneous with breach are material evidence in litigation and regulatory proceedings

name: Physical Security and Surveillance Data
description: Electronic Video Surveillance System (EVSS) footage from data center facilities and offices, badge access logs, biometric authentication records, visitor access registries, and physical security event data collected under Rackspace's internal physical security policies to safeguard properties, workplaces, personnel, and hosted data.

retention_policy.minimum_retention: 30 days for CCTV footage; 90 days minimum for data center facilities; 1 year for badge access logs
retention_policy.minimum_retention_basis: Rackspace Physical Security Policy; SOC 2 Type II Logical and Physical Access control requirements; GDPR Article 9 special category processing basis for biometric authentication data (legitimate interest / vital interest); UK DPA 2018 Schedule 1 conditions for biometric processing
retention_policy.maximum_retention: 90 days for routine CCTV footage; 1 year for badge access logs; biometric template records: duration of employment/engagement plus 30 days; security incidents: 3 years; visitor logs: 1 year
retention_policy.maximum_retention_basis: GDPR data minimization principle (Article 5(1)(c)); GDPR Article 9 requires strict proportionality for biometric data; ICO CCTV Code of Practice — standard retention 30-31 days; CCPA includes biometric data as sensitive personal information requiring opt-out
retention_policy.destruction_method: Scheduled overwrite for video surveillance systems; secure deletion of biometric templates upon employment termination; badge access log purge on rolling retention schedule; DPIA on file for biometric authentication deployment per GDPR Article 35
retention_policy.legal_hold_status: None standard; incident-related footage retained indefinitely pending resolution; December 2022 physical access logs for affected data center facilities subject to breach investigation hold

name: Incident Response and Forensic Data
description: Cybersecurity incident records, forensic investigation artifacts, breach notification logs, and post-incident remediation data, including artifacts from the December 2022 Hosted Exchange ransomware incident that caused service disruptions and prompted class-action litigation, managed under incident response plans with Audit Committee escalation procedures.

retention_policy.minimum_retention: 3 years for DFARS cyber incident records; 5 years for GDPR breach notification records
retention_policy.minimum_retention_basis: DFARS 252.204-7012(m) — cyber incident records 3 years; GDPR Article 33(5) — breach notification documentation 5 years; FedRAMP Moderate incident response records 3 years; NIST SP 800-61 Rev.2 — post-incident activity documentation
retention_policy.maximum_retention: Indefinite pending resolution of December 2022 breach litigation and regulatory proceedings; routine forensic artifacts 7 years post-incident resolution
retention_policy.maximum_retention_basis: Active litigation hold — Play ransomware incident (December 2022); customer class-action lawsuit preservation obligation; SEC disclosure investigation; Texas AG inquiry; all forensic artifacts, IR runbooks, and breach notification records are material evidence exempt from scheduled destruction
retention_policy.destruction_method: GC-authorized destruction only following written legal hold release; secure deletion with forensic verification; chain-of-custody documentation maintained throughout retention period
retention_policy.legal_hold_status: Active — indefinite hold; December 2022 Play ransomware breach is subject to multiple concurrent proceedings including customer class action, SEC investigation, and state regulatory inquiries; GC must authorize any destruction

name: Data Center Environmental Data
description: Power consumption, cooling system telemetry, temperature and humidity monitoring, uninterruptible power supply status, generator runtime data, and environmental management system metrics from data center facilities operated across Americas, EMEA, and APJ regions, including facilities hosted by Digital Realty Trust, Equinix, Iron Mountain, and Shanghai Data Solution.

retention_policy.minimum_retention: 2 years for operational telemetry; 3 years for SOC 2 and FedRAMP audit evidence
retention_policy.minimum_retention_basis: SOC 2 Type II audit evidence retention 1 year post-report; FedRAMP Continuous Monitoring — infrastructure telemetry 3 years; NIST SP 800-137 ISCM requirements; facility colocation agreements with Digital Realty Trust, Equinix, and Iron Mountain require operational record-keeping
retention_policy.maximum_retention: 3 years for routine telemetry; 7 years for facility lease-related operational records; Shanghai Data Solution facility records per PRC data localization laws (3 years minimum)
retention_policy.maximum_retention_basis: Prudent business practice for infrastructure planning; SOX 7-year record retention for facility-related financial obligations; PRC Cybersecurity Law Article 21 and Data Security Law for Shanghai Data Solution facility records
retention_policy.destruction_method: Automated purge from monitoring systems (time-series databases); secure deletion with rolling retention enforcement; facility partner records managed per colocation agreement terms
retention_policy.legal_hold_status: None standard; data center environmental records from December 2022 incident timeframe retained per breach investigation hold

name: Network Infrastructure Data
description: Network topology configurations, firewall rulesets, load balancer settings, BGP routing tables, DNS zone records, bandwidth utilization metrics, and RackConnect Global interconnection data spanning PublicNet (internet-facing) and ServiceNet (internal data center) network segments across regionalized service endpoints.

retention_policy.minimum_retention: 1 year for firewall rule change logs; 3 years for network topology baselines
retention_policy.minimum_retention_basis: PCI DSS v4.0 Requirement 1.3 — firewall and router configuration changes retained 1 year; NIST SP 800-53 CM-6 — configuration baseline documentation; FedRAMP Moderate network documentation 3 years; DFARS 252.204-7012 network configuration records for DIB customers 3 years
retention_policy.maximum_retention: 3 years for routing tables and DNS change history; 7 years for network architecture documents supporting SOX ITGC; BGP routing snapshots: 90 days active retention then archive
retention_policy.maximum_retention_basis: SOX IT general controls documentation requirement 7 years; audit trail for network segmentation supporting PCI DSS CDE boundary; breach litigation hold on network topology contemporaneous with December 2022 incident
retention_policy.destruction_method: Automated configuration management database (CMDB) retention enforcement; secure deletion of superseded configs; firewall ruleset archives purged per PCI-compliant schedule; breach-era network captures exempt from destruction pending legal hold release
retention_policy.legal_hold_status: Active — network firewall configs, routing tables, and segmentation records in effect during December 2022 breach are material evidence; litigation preservation order from General Counsel

name: Compute and Storage Provisioning Data
description: Server instance metadata (flavors, images, tenant IDs), virtual machine configurations, container orchestration state (Kubernetes/Rackspace Spot clusters), bare metal server inventories, storage volume allocations, and cloud resource provisioning records managed through Cloud Control Panel and API interfaces.

retention_policy.minimum_retention: 1 year for provisioning event logs; 3 years for resource inventory snapshots
retention_policy.minimum_retention_basis: PCI DSS v4.0 Requirement 2.2 — system configuration standards retained 1 year; FedRAMP Moderate CM-8 — information system component inventory maintained; SOC 2 CC6.1 logical access and provisioning evidence 1 year post-audit
retention_policy.maximum_retention: 7 years for billing-related provisioning records (SOX ITGC); 3 years for non-billable operational inventory; container/Kubernetes state: 90 days post-decommission
retention_policy.maximum_retention_basis: SOX 7-year audit trail requirement for revenue-linked provisioning events; IRS business record retention for cloud service billing; Rackspace Spot cluster operational records supporting financial audit trail
retention_policy.destruction_method: CMDB automated purge for decommissioned resources; cryptographic erasure of storage volume metadata; Kubernetes etcd snapshot retention enforced by platform policy; customer tenant ID records anonymized post-contract termination
retention_policy.legal_hold_status: None standard; provisioning records for Hosted Exchange infrastructure in effect December 2022 subject to breach investigation hold

name: Configuration and Change Management Data
description: Infrastructure-as-code templates, configuration baseline records, change advisory board documentation, release deployment manifests, and ITSM change request data supporting service delivery automation through Rackspace Fabric platform, which drives revenue per employee exceeding $500,000.

retention_policy.minimum_retention: 1 year for CAB change request records; 3 years for IaC configuration baselines
retention_policy.minimum_retention_basis: PCI DSS v4.0 Requirement 6.5 — change management records retained 1 year; FedRAMP Moderate CM-3 — change control records 3 years; NIST SP 800-53 CM-6 configuration settings documentation; SOC 2 CC8.1 change management evidence
retention_policy.maximum_retention: 7 years for change records with SOX ITGC significance; IaC templates: perpetual in version control system (git); deployment manifests: 3 years post-deployment
retention_policy.maximum_retention_basis: SOX IT general controls audit defense; Rackspace Fabric platform IP protected as trade secret; IaC version history supports forensic audit of infrastructure state at any point in time; December 2022 incident change records under litigation hold
retention_policy.destruction_method: Git repository archival and retirement policy; CMDB change ticket automated purge on retention schedule; IaC template destruction requires Engineering VP approval; secure deletion with audit log
retention_policy.legal_hold_status: Active — CAB records and configuration changes made in the period preceding December 2022 breach are material evidence; litigation preservation order covers all infrastructure change history from October-December 2022

name: Service Management and Ticketing Data
description: Incident management tickets, problem management records, service request workflows, service level agreement performance metrics, customer escalation records, and knowledge base articles managed through ITSM platforms supporting Fanatical Experience service delivery model and 24x7x365 operations.

retention_policy.minimum_retention: 3 years for standard ITSM tickets; 6 years for HIPAA BAA customer support records
retention_policy.minimum_retention_basis: FedRAMP Moderate IR-8 — incident response records 3 years; HIPAA Security Rule § 164.530(j) — 6 years for BA-related service records; PCI DSS v4.0 Requirement 12.10 — incident response records 1 year; SOC 2 audit evidence 1 year post-report
retention_policy.maximum_retention: 7 years for SLA-related customer escalation records (SOX); 6 years for HIPAA-scope support tickets; KB articles: perpetual with annual review; Fanatical Experience service metrics: 7 years for financial audit
retention_policy.maximum_retention_basis: SOX 7-year requirement for customer service revenue audit trail; GDPR Article 17 erasure requests for EU customer ticket data processed within 30 days where no competing legal basis; breach-related tickets under indefinite legal hold
retention_policy.destruction_method: ITSM platform automated retention enforcement; GDPR erasure handled through anonymization of customer PII in closed tickets; KB article retirement process with CSO/GC sign-off; breach-era support tickets exempt from destruction
retention_policy.legal_hold_status: Active — all support tickets related to December 2022 Hosted Exchange outage and customer communications retained indefinitely pending class action resolution; approximately 27 affected customer ticket chains identified as material evidence

name: AI Model Training and Inference Data
description: Training datasets, model weights, hyperparameter configurations, inference outputs, and AI governance audit trails generated through Foundry for AI by Rackspace (FAIR) practice, encompassing Ideate, Incubate, and Industrialize service phases with responsible AI directives (symbiotic, secure, sustainable).
domain_owner: President of AI, Technology and Sustainability

retention_policy.minimum_retention: Duration of model deployment; AI governance audit trails minimum 3 years
retention_policy.minimum_retention_basis: GDPR Article 22 — automated decision-making documentation required for the duration of model use; EU AI Act (effective 2024) — high-risk AI systems require 10-year post-market record retention; NIST AI RMF documentation standards; Rackspace FAIR responsible AI directives require governance audit trail
retention_policy.maximum_retention: Model weights: retained for model lifecycle plus 3 years post-decommission; training datasets containing personal data: GDPR data minimization requires deletion or anonymization post-training unless ongoing legitimate basis; AI audit trails: 10 years for high-risk AI systems under EU AI Act
retention_policy.maximum_retention_basis: EU AI Act Title III Chapter 2 Article 19 — high-risk AI system logs retained minimum 10 years; GDPR right to explanation (Article 22) requires documentation of logic; Rackspace FAIR symbiotic/secure/sustainable directives create internal governance retention obligations
retention_policy.destruction_method: Model weight deletion from inference endpoints at decommission; training dataset anonymization or deletion per GDPR data minimization; AI governance audit logs archived to cold storage after active deployment period; cryptographic verification of training data deletion provided to customers on request
retention_policy.legal_hold_status: None standard; AI models trained on or used to analyze December 2022 breach-related data subject to incident litigation hold

name: Business Intelligence and Reporting Data
description: Analytical datasets, dashboard configurations, BI report definitions, and data visualization outputs across PowerBI, Tableau, Looker, Qlik, and QuickSight platforms, including operational KPIs, customer usage analytics, capacity planning models, and executive reporting data supporting segment-level financial analysis.

retention_policy.minimum_retention: 3 years for operational BI reports; 7 years for financial segment analysis dashboards
retention_policy.minimum_retention_basis: SOX Section 802 — financial records supporting segment reporting retained 7 years; SEC Rule 17a-4 — financial analysis records 7 years; GAAP record retention principles; SOC 2 audit evidence supporting operational KPIs 1 year post-report
retention_policy.maximum_retention: 7 years for all SOX-scope financial BI assets; 3 years for non-financial operational dashboards; customer usage analytics: 3 years or customer contract term plus 1 year, whichever is greater; capacity planning models: 5 years
retention_policy.maximum_retention_basis: SOX 7-year financial record requirement governs financial KPI and segment-reporting dashboards; GDPR data minimization for customer-identifiable usage analytics (pseudonymization preferred over retention); competitive sensitivity of capacity planning and pricing models
retention_policy.destruction_method: BI platform report archival and purge on retention schedule; customer usage analytics anonymized after contract termination; executive report archives managed by CFO office with 7-year secure retention; capacity models marked trade secret and require CFO approval for destruction
retention_policy.legal_hold_status: Active — financial performance dashboards and customer segment analytics from 2022-2023 retained pending SEC disclosure investigation and securities litigation; breach-period BI reports reflecting financial impact are material evidence

name: Data Pipeline and ETL Orchestration Data
description: Data ingestion configurations, ETL/ELT pipeline definitions, data transformation logic, Apache Spark and PySpark job metadata, data quality validation rules, CDC (change data capture) configurations, and DataOps monitoring telemetry from 24x7x365 global DataOps team operations across AWS Glue, Azure Data Factory, and Google Cloud Dataflow platforms.

retention_policy.minimum_retention: 1 year for operational pipeline logs; 3 years for ETL configuration baselines
retention_policy.minimum_retention_basis: SOC 2 CC8.1 change management evidence 1 year post-audit; FedRAMP Moderate CM-3 change control records 3 years; NIST SP 800-53 CM-6 configuration documentation; DataOps SLA audit evidence supporting customer billing
retention_policy.maximum_retention: 3 years for pipeline configuration versions; perpetual for IaC-managed pipeline definitions in version control; operational monitoring telemetry: 90 days active then archive
retention_policy.maximum_retention_basis: Rackspace Fabric and DataOps platform IP treated as trade secret requiring indefinite version history; SOX ITGC audit trail for revenue-linked data pipelines 7 years; PCI DSS data processing pipeline change records 1 year minimum
retention_policy.destruction_method: Git repository archival per platform retirement policy; time-series telemetry automated purge; CDC configuration archives require VP Data Services approval for destruction; cryptographic erasure for cloud-managed pipeline state
retention_policy.legal_hold_status: None standard; pipeline configurations processing Hosted Exchange customer data during December 2022 incident timeframe subject to breach investigation hold

name: Website Analytics and Tracking Data
description: Cookie-based session data, web beacon pixel tracking from marketing emails, clickstream data, referral URL analytics, browser fingerprinting attributes, advertising technology identifiers, and DNT signal processing data collected via rackspace.com and associated web properties, managed under the Global Cookie Notice with consent tool mechanisms.

retention_policy.minimum_retention: Session cookies: 30 days; analytics identifiers: up to 13 months per GA4 maximum
retention_policy.minimum_retention_basis: GDPR Article 5(1)(e) storage limitation — analytics data retained no longer than necessary; ICO Cookie Guidance — consent-based cookies tied to consent duration; CCPA Section 1798.120 opt-out right for sale/sharing of personal information; Rackspace Global Cookie Notice (consent tool) establishes consent basis per cookie category
retention_policy.maximum_retention: Analytics session data: 13 months maximum (Google Analytics 4 default); ad tech identifiers: 90 days or consent withdrawal, whichever is sooner; aggregated analytics (non-PII): 3 years; DNT signal records: 2 years for compliance evidence
retention_policy.maximum_retention_basis: GDPR data minimization principle; EDPB Guidance on consent for cookies; CCPA right to deletion applies to device identifiers and browsing history; ePrivacy Directive (EU Cookie Law) requires consent refresh for persistent cookies
retention_policy.destruction_method: Consent withdrawal triggers automated deletion from analytics platforms (Google Analytics, Adobe Analytics); cookie database purge on consent expiry; CCPA deletion requests processed within 45 days; aggregated non-PII data retained after individual identifier deletion
retention_policy.legal_hold_status: None — website analytics data is not subject to breach litigation hold; GDPR erasure requests processed per Privacy Notice commitments

name: Marketing Automation and Lead Data
description: Lead generation form submissions, event registration records, webinar attendance data, email campaign performance metrics (open rates, click-through rates), content download tracking, and marketing qualified lead scoring data collected via rackspace.com with consent under the Privacy Notice.

retention_policy.minimum_retention: Duration of marketing consent or 3 years from last meaningful engagement
retention_policy.minimum_retention_basis: GDPR Article 6(1)(a) — consent basis requires retention only while consent valid; CAN-SPAM Act — opt-out requests honored within 10 business days; CCPA right to deletion (Section 1798.105); Rackspace Privacy Notice — marketing data retained as long as reasonably necessary
retention_policy.maximum_retention: 3 years from last meaningful interaction for non-converted leads; 7 years post-conversion for MQL-to-customer records (SOX/revenue attribution); email performance metrics (aggregated, non-PII): 5 years; immediately upon verified opt-out or deletion request
retention_policy.maximum_retention_basis: GDPR data minimization; CCPA right to deletion; CAN-SPAM permanent suppression list retention (opt-outs must be honored for 10 years per FTC guidance); SOX revenue attribution audit trail for converted leads; Salesforce CRM retention policy
retention_policy.destruction_method: Marketing automation platform (Marketo/HubSpot/Salesforce Marketing Cloud) suppression list update on opt-out; GDPR erasure request processed within 30 days; CCPA deletion within 45 days; individual identifier deletion while retaining aggregated campaign analytics
retention_policy.legal_hold_status: None — marketing data not implicated in breach litigation; GDPR/CCPA deletion requests processed per Privacy Notice

name: SOC Attestation and Audit Data
description: SOC 1 Type 2, SOC 2 Type 2 (Security, Availability Trust Services Criteria), and SOC 3 attestation report data for dedicated hosting services, including control effectiveness evidence, exception documentation, and complementary user entity control requirements shared with customers under NDA.

retention_policy.minimum_retention: 3 years for SOC reports and supporting evidence
retention_policy.minimum_retention_basis: AICPA AT-C Section 205 — attest engagement working papers retained 5 years from report date; SOC 2 customer NDA agreements: contract term plus 3 years; FedRAMP continuous monitoring evidence: 3 years; PCAOB AS 1215 (for financial SOC 1): 7 years working paper retention
retention_policy.maximum_retention: 5 years for SOC working papers; 7 years for SOC 1 evidence relevant to financial reporting (PCAOB / SOX intersection); SOC 3 public reports: perpetual for commercial reference; exception documentation: 5 years post-remediation
retention_policy.maximum_retention_basis: AICPA professional standards for attestation working papers; SOX Section 802 for SOC 1 financial controls evidence; prudent business practice for certification continuity and customer due diligence requests
retention_policy.destruction_method: Secure deletion with auditor sign-off; working papers destruction per AICPA retention schedule; control evidence archives encrypted at rest; exception documentation destruction requires VP Compliance and Legal approval
retention_policy.legal_hold_status: Active — SOC 2 reports and control evidence covering the December 2022 audit period are material evidence in breach litigation; SOC 2 exception documentation contemporaneous with breach is subject to litigation preservation order

name: ISO Certification and Management System Data
description: Information security management system (ISMS) documentation for ISO 27001, environmental management system records for ISO 14001, quality management system data for ISO 9001, occupational health and safety data for ISO 45001, and supplementary cloud security (27017), PII protection (27018), and privacy management (27701) certification evidence.

retention_policy.minimum_retention: 3 years for ISMS records; 3-year audit cycle for all ISO management system evidence
retention_policy.minimum_retention_basis: ISO 27001:2022 Clause 7.5 — documented information retained as evidence of conformity; ISO 27001 Annex A.5.33 — information security documentation retention; ISO 27701 PIMS records retention per GDPR Article 30 obligations; certification body (BSI/Bureau Veritas) surveillance audit evidence requirements
retention_policy.maximum_retention: 3 years between re-certification cycles; ISMS risk assessments: 3 years post-update; ISO 14001 environmental records: 5 years; ISO 45001 incident records: 5 years; ISO 27701 PIMS documentation: 3 years post-GDPR transfer basis expiry
retention_policy.maximum_retention_basis: ISO management system standard audit cycle requirements; certification continuity for commercial customer due diligence; GDPR Article 30 RoPA documentation for ISO 27701 PIMS scope; ISO 14001 regulatory compliance evidence retention
retention_policy.destruction_method: Systematic ISMS document control process; superseded policy versions archived then destroyed after 3-year retention; certification body notification required before destruction of audit evidence; electronic records purged from document management system with destruction log
retention_policy.legal_hold_status: Active — ISO 27001 ISMS records including risk assessments and security policies in effect during December 2022 breach are material evidence; ISO 27701 PIMS documentation relevant to privacy breach notification obligations subject to litigation hold

name: FedRAMP Continuous Monitoring Data
description: FedRAMP JAB authorization package data including system security plans, plans of action and milestones (POAMs), continuous monitoring reports, security assessment results, and inheritable security control documentation covering approximately 80% of customer FedRAMP ATO requirements across 23 total authorizations.

retention_policy.minimum_retention: 3 years for authorization package and ConMon reports
retention_policy.minimum_retention_basis: FedRAMP PMO policy — authorization package (SSP, SAP, SAR, POA&M) retained 3 years post-authorization expiration; OMB Circular A-130 — federal information system records retention; NIST SP 800-53 CA-7 continuous monitoring documentation; FedRAMP Rev5 ConMon monthly deliverable archival requirement
retention_policy.maximum_retention: 3 years post-ATO expiration for all 23 authorization packages; POAMs: 3 years after closure or authorization expiration; SSPs: duration of ATO plus 3 years; security assessment reports: 3 years from issuance date
retention_policy.maximum_retention_basis: FedRAMP PMO record retention policy; NARA disposition schedule for CSP authorization records; 32 CFR Part 2002 for CUI-classified portions of authorization packages; FedRAMP Marketplace listing records perpetual for business development continuity
retention_policy.destruction_method: FedRAMP PMO-coordinated secure deletion; NIST 800-88 for digital authorization records; CUI-designated portions require NSA-approved destruction; destruction certified to FedRAMP PMO and sponsoring JAB agencies
retention_policy.legal_hold_status: None — FedRAMP authorization for Government Cloud was not directly implicated in December 2022 breach (breach affected Hosted Exchange, not Government Cloud); standard retention applies

name: Subprocessor Data Flows
description: Customer personal data transferred to authorized subprocessors (Amazon, Microsoft, Google, Alibaba as explicitly named in DPA) and additional subprocessors listed at rackspace.com/gdpr/subprocessors, including transfer impact assessments, Standard Contractual Clauses execution records, and subprocessor compliance attestations.

retention_policy.minimum_retention: Duration of subprocessor engagement plus 3 years for DPA and SCC records
retention_policy.minimum_retention_basis: GDPR Article 28(3) — sub-processor agreements retained for duration of processing; EU Commission Decision 2021/914 SCC Module 3 — sub-processor SCCs retained for duration of transfer plus 3 years; GDPR Article 30 RoPA requires ongoing documentation of sub-processor relationships; APEC CBPR certification records 3 years
retention_policy.maximum_retention: Sub-processor DPA records: 3 years post-termination of sub-processor engagement; TIAs for Amazon/Microsoft/Google/Alibaba: 3 years post-transfer; sub-processor compliance attestations (SOC 2, ISO 27001): current plus immediately preceding 2 years
retention_policy.maximum_retention_basis: GDPR accountability principle (Article 5(2)); ICO sub-processor management guidance; EDPB Recommendations 01/2020 on international transfers; Schrems II Tele2 ruling requiring documented TIA for each transfer to third countries
retention_policy.destruction_method: Secure deletion of superseded sub-processor agreements; TIA archive maintained per DPA schedule; publicly-listed sub-processor records at rackspace.com/gdpr/subprocessors retained for regulatory reference; sub-processor exit records maintained 3 years after removal from approved list
retention_policy.legal_hold_status: Active — sub-processor flow records for Amazon and Microsoft (Azure/O365) subprocessing during December 2022 breach period retained as material evidence in GDPR supervisory authority investigation and customer litigation

name: Partner Ecosystem and Alliance Data
description: Technology alliance partnership data spanning AWS (SI Partner of the Year NAMER, Generative AI Competency), Microsoft (Data and AI strategic partner, Copilot Ready-Tier), Google Cloud (first managed services partner), VMware by Broadcom, Dell Technologies (Global Alliances Service Provider of Year), Oracle, and Snowflake (Premier Partner) relationships.

retention_policy.minimum_retention: Contract term plus 7 years for partnership agreements
retention_policy.minimum_retention_basis: IRS business record retention for revenue-related partnership agreements; SOX Section 802 — revenue-affecting partner contracts 7 years; NDA agreements: contract term plus 5 years; AWS/Microsoft/Google/VMware/Dell/Oracle/Snowflake partnership certification records: per certification body renewal cycle (typically 3 years)
retention_policy.maximum_retention: 7 years post-contract expiration for SOX-scope partnership agreements; partner certification records: 3 years post-certification expiration; rebate and incentive calculations: 7 years (IRS/SOX); partnership NDA and confidential disclosures: 7 years post-agreement termination
retention_policy.maximum_retention_basis: SOX 7-year requirement for revenue-affecting agreements; IRS statute of limitations for business deductions; partner certification credentialing requires historical evidence for renewals; Apollo Global Management reporting obligations for material partnerships
retention_policy.destruction_method: Secure deletion per records management program; partner NDA archives require Legal sign-off before destruction; certification documents retained in digital form with 7-year rolling retention; financial incentive records archived to cold storage at 3 years
retention_policy.legal_hold_status: None standard; partner agreement records implicated in Apollo LBO due diligence and March 2024 refinancing subject to ongoing review

name: Law Enforcement Request Data
description: Legal demands for customer data received from law enforcement agencies worldwide, documented in the annual Rackspace Technology Law Enforcement Request Disclosure Report, including subpoena and warrant tracking, non-content vs. content data request classification, and compliance response records per applicable jurisdictional laws.

retention_policy.minimum_retention: 5 years for legal demand response records
retention_policy.minimum_retention_basis: 18 U.S.C. § 2703 (Stored Communications Act) — response records retained; DOJ/FBI legal process compliance records; GDPR Article 6(1)(c) legal obligation basis for disclosure; ECPA compliance documentation; annual transparency report data retained per SEC disclosure obligations
retention_policy.maximum_retention: 7 years for warrant and subpoena response records; transparency report data: perpetual (published annually); non-disclosure order (NSL gag order) records: duration of non-disclosure obligation; international legal assistance treaty (MLAT) records: 7 years
retention_policy.maximum_retention_basis: SOX 7-year legal record requirement; prudent business practice for legal liability defense; GDPR accountability principle — demonstrating lawful basis for government disclosure; Rackspace commitment to publishing Law Enforcement Request Disclosure Report annually
retention_policy.destruction_method: Secure deletion with GC sign-off; NSL-implicated records require FBI authorization before destruction; MLAT records managed per treaty terms; records of requests for which Rackspace challenged or resisted compliance retained indefinitely
retention_policy.legal_hold_status: Active — law enforcement requests related to December 2022 breach investigation and any customer data disclosures made in that context are material to concurrent civil litigation; all government request records from 2022-2023 subject to litigation hold

name: Litigation and Legal Hold Data
description: Active and historical litigation records including class-action proceedings related to the December 2022 Hosted Exchange ransomware incident, legal hold preservation orders, e-discovery data collections, regulatory investigation correspondence, and insurance claim documentation.

retention_policy.minimum_retention: Indefinite pending resolution of all active matters
retention_policy.minimum_retention_basis: Federal Rules of Civil Procedure Rule 37(e) — ESI preservation duty triggered upon reasonable anticipation of litigation; FRCP Rule 26 — e-discovery disclosure obligations; Texas Rules of Civil Procedure equivalent obligations; SEC investigation subpoena response records; GDPR supervisory authority investigation record preservation
retention_policy.maximum_retention: 7 years post-final judgment or settlement for resolved matters; insurance claim records: 7 years post-closure; attorney-client privileged communications: perpetual while privilege maintained; e-discovery collections: through final judgment plus 7 years for closed matters
retention_policy.maximum_retention_basis: SOX 7-year legal record requirement; IRS statute of limitations for financial implications of settlement payments; D&O and cyber insurance policy audit trail; prudent practice for class action defense — December 2022 breach litigation may not reach final resolution for 5-10 years from inception
retention_policy.destruction_method: GC-authorized destruction only; privileged communications require attorney sign-off; settlement records require CFO and GC joint authorization; e-discovery collection destruction governed by court order upon case closure; insurance claim records require CFO authorization
retention_policy.legal_hold_status: Active — indefinite hold; encompasses class action (Hosted Exchange customers), SEC cybersecurity disclosure investigation, state AG inquiries, GDPR supervisory authority investigation, and cyber insurance claim; GC office manages litigation hold matrix

name: Board and Corporate Governance Data
description: Board of Directors meeting minutes, Audit Committee cybersecurity briefing records (quarterly updates from CSO), compensation committee deliberations, proxy statement data, corporate governance guidelines compliance records, and Apollo Global Management affiliated entity transaction documentation.

retention_policy.minimum_retention: Permanent for Board meeting minutes; 7 years for committee records
retention_policy.minimum_retention_basis: Delaware General Corporation Law § 220 — corporate records permanently retained; SEC Rule 17a-4 — governance records 7 years; Dodd-Frank and SOX Audit Committee requirements; NYSE/Nasdaq governance standards; proxy statement supporting materials — SEC requires 3 years
retention_policy.maximum_retention: Permanent for board minutes and resolutions; 7 years for Audit Committee cybersecurity briefings (SOX/SEC cybersecurity disclosure rule); compensation committee records: 7 years post-decision; Apollo affiliated transaction documentation: 7 years post-transaction per SOX
retention_policy.maximum_retention_basis: Delaware corporate law permanent records requirement; SOX Section 802 for audit committee deliberations; SEC Rule 10b-5 litigation defense for compensation and Apollo transaction records; proxy statement supporting materials — SEC 3-year minimum
retention_policy.destruction_method: No destruction for permanent corporate records (board minutes, resolutions, articles of incorporation); committee records destruction per 7-year schedule with GC and CFO authorization; Apollo transaction records require board resolution to destroy
retention_policy.legal_hold_status: Active — Audit Committee cybersecurity briefings regarding December 2022 breach are material to SEC investigation and securities litigation; board deliberations on breach disclosure timing and materiality determinations subject to preservation order

name: Enterprise Risk Management Data
description: Risk register entries, risk assessment scoring models, cybersecurity risk management integration data, materiality determination records for SEC cybersecurity disclosure compliance, insurance policy coverage data (D&O, cyber, general liability), and enterprise risk committee deliberation records.

retention_policy.minimum_retention: 7 years for risk assessments and SEC materiality determinations
retention_policy.minimum_retention_basis: SEC Rule 13a-20 (Cybersecurity Disclosure Rule, effective 2023) — cybersecurity risk management records retained 7 years; SOX Section 302/404 — management risk assessment documentation 7 years; D&O and cyber insurance policy records: policy term plus 7 years; ERM committee minutes: 7 years per corporate governance standards
retention_policy.maximum_retention: 7 years for all ERM records; SEC cybersecurity materiality determination records: 7 years from disclosure date; insurance policy records: 7 years post-expiration; risk register: 7 years per entry; risk committee deliberations on December 2022 breach materiality: indefinite pending litigation resolution
retention_policy.maximum_retention_basis: SEC enforcement statute of limitations (5 years) plus prudent 2-year buffer; SOX 7-year requirement for management assessments; insurance litigation defense requires policy-period records; December 2022 breach materiality determinations are material to SEC investigation
retention_policy.destruction_method: Secure deletion per records management schedule; risk assessments require CISO and CFO sign-off before destruction; SEC cybersecurity disclosure supporting records require GC authorization; breach-related materiality determinations exempt from destruction pending litigation
retention_policy.legal_hold_status: Active — risk register entries, SEC cybersecurity materiality determinations, and insurance claim records related to December 2022 breach subject to preservation order; SEC investigation focuses specifically on materiality assessment and disclosure timing

name: Environmental and Sustainability Data
description: Carbon footprint calculations, energy consumption metrics across global data center portfolio, ISO 14001 environmental management records, SustainableIT.org Sustainability Impact Award evidence, and ESG reporting data including environmental targets and performance disclosures managed under the President of AI, Technology and Sustainability.
domain_owner: President of AI, Technology and Sustainability

retention_policy.minimum_retention: 5 years for ISO 14001 EMS records; 3 years for ESG reporting data
retention_policy.minimum_retention_basis: ISO 14001:2015 Clause 7.5 — documented information retained as evidence of EMS conformity; ISO 14001 Annex A requires 5-year evidence retention for audit cycle; GHG Protocol Corporate Standard — carbon emissions data retained 5 years; SEC proposed climate disclosure rules (ESG reporting) — underlying data 7 years
retention_policy.maximum_retention: 5 years for energy consumption and carbon footprint records; ISO 14001 certification evidence: 3-year audit cycle plus preceding cycle; ESG disclosure supporting data: 7 years per proposed SEC climate rules; SustainableIT.org award submission records: perpetual for commercial reference
retention_policy.maximum_retention_basis: ISO 14001 audit cycle evidence requirements; emerging SEC climate disclosure rule (proposing 7-year retention for GHG and climate-related data); EU Corporate Sustainability Reporting Directive (CSRD) — applicable to EU subsidiaries (Rackspace Germany GmbH); data center energy efficiency metrics supporting PUE reporting to colocation partners
retention_policy.destruction_method: Automated purge from energy management systems on retention schedule; ISO 14001 audit evidence archived per document control process; award submission materials archived in marketing records; carbon credit documentation managed per VCS/Gold Standard registry requirements
retention_policy.legal_hold_status: None — environmental data is not implicated in current litigation; standard retention applies

name: Supply Chain and Procurement Data
description: Vendor management records, supplier code of conduct compliance documentation, conflict minerals due diligence data per Dodd-Frank Section 1502, modern slavery statement disclosures, hardware procurement specifications, and data center equipment lifecycle management data.

retention_policy.minimum_retention: 5 years for Dodd-Frank conflict minerals reports; 7 years for vendor contracts
retention_policy.minimum_retention_basis: Dodd-Frank Section 1502 — conflict minerals due diligence records retained 5 years (SEC Rule 13p-1); UK Modern Slavery Act 2015 — annual statements permanently filed; SOX Section 802 — procurement contracts supporting revenue 7 years; IRS business deduction records for hardware purchases 7 years
retention_policy.maximum_retention: 7 years for vendor agreements and procurement records; hardware lifecycle records: asset retirement plus 7 years; supplier code of conduct compliance: 7 years; conflict minerals RCOI records: 5 years; modern slavery statements: permanent (publicly filed)
retention_policy.maximum_retention_basis: SOX 7-year audit requirement for procurement-related financial records; IRS statute of limitations for capital expenditure depreciation; DFARS supply chain security records for defense contracts; Apollo Global Management supply chain audit requirements under PE portfolio management
retention_policy.destruction_method: Records management program automated purge; publicly-filed modern slavery statements exempt from destruction; hardware asset records destroyed with CFO approval; procurement records destruction requires VP procurement sign-off; vendor NDA records require Legal sign-off
retention_policy.legal_hold_status: None standard; hardware procurement records for Hosted Exchange infrastructure implicated in December 2022 breach subject to investigation hold

name: Encryption Key and Certificate Data
description: Cryptographic key material, TLS certificate inventories, customer-managed encryption key metadata, hardware security module (HSM) configuration records, and key rotation lifecycle data supporting data-at-rest and data-in-transit encryption across hosted environments, with customer option to manage their own keys.

retention_policy.minimum_retention: Key rotation logs and certificate lifecycle records: 7 years
