retention_policy.minimum_retention_basis: PCI DSS v4.0 Requirement 3.7 — cryptographic key management procedures and evidence retained; NIST SP 800-57 Part 1 Rev.5 — key usage period and post-use retention guidance; FedRAMP Moderate SC-12 — cryptographic key management documentation; SOX ITGC — encryption control audit trail 7 years; HIPAA Security Rule § 164.312(a)(2)(iv) encryption and decryption documentation
retention_policy.maximum_retention: Active private key material: NEVER retained beyond key lifecycle; revoked/expired key metadata (not key material): 7 years post-expiry; TLS certificate records: 3 years post-expiry; HSM configuration records: duration of HSM deployment plus 7 years; CMEK audit logs: 7 years
retention_policy.maximum_retention_basis: NIST SP 800-57 — private key material must be destroyed at end of cryptoperiod; PCI DSS Requirement 3.7.4 — cryptographic key retirement and replacement; SOX audit trail for encryption controls supporting financial data protection; FedRAMP key management lifecycle documentation for 23 ATOs
retention_policy.destruction_method: HSM-enforced key zeroization at cryptoperiod end; FIPS 140-2 Level 3 HSM destruction procedures; TLS certificate revocation and metadata secure deletion; CMEK customer key deletion coordinated per DPA; key destruction events logged with timestamp and authorizing principal; breach-era key material exempt from destruction pending forensic analysis
retention_policy.legal_hold_status: Active — encryption key material and HSM audit logs in effect during December 2022 breach are material forensic evidence; Play ransomware encrypted Hosted Exchange PST archives using customer key infrastructure; key management records subject to indefinite preservation order

name: Backup and Disaster Recovery Data
description: Backup job metadata, recovery point and recovery time objective tracking, Rackspace Data Protection (powered by Cohesity) backup service records, Cyber Recovery Cloud (powered by Rubrik) immutable backup copies, disaster recovery runbook data, and business continuity test results across multi-region failover configurations.

retention_policy.minimum_retention: 3 years for backup metadata and DR test results
retention_policy.minimum_retention_basis: SOC 2 Availability Trust Services Criteria — backup and recovery test evidence 1 year post-report; FedRAMP Moderate CP-9 — information system backup documentation 3 years; PCI DSS v4.0 Requirement 12.5.2 — business continuity plans and test results 1 year; HIPAA Security Rule § 164.308(a)(7) — emergency mode operation plan documentation 6 years
retention_policy.maximum_retention: 7 years for DR runbooks and BC test results (SOX ITGC business continuity controls); immutable backup copies: per customer SLA (Cohesity/Rubrik retention tiers); backup job metadata: 3 years; RPO/RTO performance records: 3 years; breach-era backup status records: indefinite pending litigation
retention_policy.maximum_retention_basis: SOX IT general controls documentation for business continuity; HIPAA 6-year retention floor for emergency mode operation plan; FedRAMP contingency plan testing results 3 years; December 2022 breach demonstrated that Hosted Exchange lacked adequate immutable backup — backup records for that period are material evidence
retention_policy.destruction_method: Backup platform (Cohesity/Rubrik) automated retention enforcement per SLA tier; DR runbook archival per change management process; immutable backup content destruction requires customer authorization and cryptographic erasure; metadata purge on rolling retention schedule; breach-era records exempt from destruction
retention_policy.legal_hold_status: Active — backup status and recovery records for Hosted Exchange infrastructure covering November-December 2022 are material evidence in breach litigation; absence of immutable backups for affected PST archives is central to class action allegations; all backup metadata from this period preserved indefinitely

name: Tax Compliance Data
description: Domestic and foreign tax calculation data, transfer pricing documentation, property tax abatement records (Master Economic Incentives Agreement), UK Tax Strategy publication data per Finance Act 2016 Schedule 19, deferred tax asset/liability schedules, and federal/state/foreign net operating loss carryforward tracking.

retention_policy.minimum_retention: 7 years for domestic tax records; 10 years for transfer pricing documentation
retention_policy.minimum_retention_basis: IRS Rev. Proc. 98-25 and IRC § 6001 — tax records minimum 7 years; Treasury Reg. § 1.6662-6(d) — transfer pricing contemporaneous documentation retained 10 years; UK Finance Act 2016 Schedule 19 — UK Tax Strategy publication records 6 years; OECD BEPS Action 13 country-by-country reporting: 5 years minimum
retention_policy.maximum_retention: 10 years for transfer pricing records and intercompany transaction documentation; 7 years for standard tax workpapers; NOL carryforward supporting records: retained until NOL fully utilized plus 7 years; property tax abatement (Master Economic Incentives Agreement): duration of abatement plus 7 years
retention_policy.maximum_retention_basis: IRS fraud exception to 3-year statute extends to 6 years for substantial omission; prudent 7-year retention for all records; OECD BEPS transfer pricing documentation requirement; Texas property tax abatement agreement compliance documentation per Bexar County MEIA
retention_policy.destruction_method: Secure deletion per tax records management schedule; CFO and external tax counsel sign-off required for transfer pricing record destruction; UK Tax Strategy records managed by Rackspace Limited UK subsidiary; destruction certificates maintained for audit trail
retention_policy.legal_hold_status: None standard; tax records implicated in financial restatement risk or SEC investigation subject to hold; Apollo LBO and March 2024 refinancing tax documentation under ongoing review

name: Anti-Bribery and Sanctions Compliance Data
description: Foreign Corrupt Practices Act and UK Bribery Act compliance records, OFAC sanctions screening results, anti-money laundering due diligence data, and export control screening logs for customer onboarding across 120 countries of operation.

retention_policy.minimum_retention: 5 years for OFAC sanctions screening and AML due diligence records
retention_policy.minimum_retention_basis: 31 CFR Part 501 (OFAC) — sanctions compliance records 5 years; FinCEN / BSA — AML due diligence records 5 years; FCPA DOJ/SEC enforcement guidance — 5-7 year compliance program records retention; UK Bribery Act 2010 — adequate procedures records 6 years; EAR 15 CFR Part 762 — export control screening records 5 years
retention_policy.maximum_retention: 7 years for FCPA/UK Bribery Act compliance records (statute of limitations defense); 5 years for OFAC screening results; AML customer due diligence: 5 years post-relationship termination; export control screening: 5 years per EAR; high-risk jurisdiction onboarding records: 7 years
retention_policy.maximum_retention_basis: FCPA 5-year statute of limitations plus 2-year buffer; UK Bribery Act 6-year limitation period; GDPR Article 5(1)(e) requires balancing retention against proportionality for third-country screening PII; OFAC SDGT designations require records for duration of sanctions designation
retention_policy.destruction_method: Secure deletion of customer screening records; GDPR erasure requests for EU customer PII in screening records processed with legal basis review; AML records destruction requires GC sign-off; OFAC-related records destruction only after confirmed no active sanctions obligations
retention_policy.legal_hold_status: None standard; OFAC and AML screening records for customers in sanctioned jurisdictions maintained per OFAC compliance obligations; no active investigations related to breach

name: Customer Portal and API Access Data
description: MyRackspace customer portal session data, Cloud Control Panel interaction logs, API authentication tokens (username and API key credentials), tenant-scoped resource identifiers, and customer self-service configuration requests submitted through regionalized service access endpoints.

retention_policy.minimum_retention: 1 year for portal session logs; 7 years for API access audit records tied to billing
retention_policy.minimum_retention_basis: PCI DSS v4.0 Requirement 8.3 — user access records 1 year minimum; SOX ITGC — customer portal access audit trail 7 years for revenue-linked actions; FedRAMP Moderate AC-17 — remote access monitoring 3 years; GDPR Article 30 RoPA for processing customer portal PII
retention_policy.maximum_retention: 7 years for tenant provisioning and billing-linked access records (SOX); 1 year for session logs and authentication event data; API tokens: never persisted beyond session lifetime; portal interaction history: 3 years for customer self-service support
retention_policy.maximum_retention_basis: SOX 7-year audit trail for revenue-linked customer portal interactions; GDPR data minimization principle for session data (shorter is better); PCI DSS scope for portal sessions involving billing or payment actions; customer right of access under GDPR (Article 15) may require portal data retention to respond to requests
retention_policy.destruction_method: Portal platform automated session log purge on retention schedule; API token rotation invalidates expired tokens without retention; tenant ID records anonymized post-contract termination; billing-linked portal records archived to cold storage per SOX schedule
retention_policy.legal_hold_status: Active — MyRackspace portal access logs and Cloud Control Panel activity for Hosted Exchange customers during November-December 2022 are material evidence in breach litigation; portal session data showing customer access to breach-affected services subject to preservation order

name: Rackspace Fabric Automation Data
description: Proprietary automation platform telemetry including service delivery automation workflows, self-healing infrastructure event data, proactive threat/opportunity detection signals, customer experience consistency metrics, and application management process orchestration data that drives the efficient business model generating $500K+ revenue per employee.

retention_policy.minimum_retention: 3 years for operational telemetry; perpetual for automation workflow definitions
retention_policy.minimum_retention_basis: SOX ITGC — revenue-generating platform automation controls audit trail 7 years; SOC 2 CC8.1 change management evidence 1 year post-audit; Rackspace trade secret protection program — Fabric platform source and configuration is core competitive IP; FedRAMP Moderate CM-4 — security impact analysis documentation 3 years
retention_policy.maximum_retention: 7 years for Fabric platform performance metrics supporting financial audit trail; 3 years for operational telemetry and self-healing event logs; workflow definitions: perpetual in version-controlled repository; proactive threat/opportunity detection signals: 90 days active then 3-year archive
retention_policy.maximum_retention_basis: Rackspace Fabric drives $500K+ revenue per employee — platform IP classification as trade secret requires indefinite protection of core algorithms; SOX ITGC documentation for automation controls supporting financial reporting; Apollo Global Management portfolio company IP valuation for refinancing and potential exit
retention_policy.destruction_method: Trade secret designation requires CTO and CFO approval before any destruction of core Fabric IP; operational telemetry automated purge; version-controlled workflow definitions archived per platform retirement process; destruction prohibited absent board-level decision on IP disposition
retention_policy.legal_hold_status: Active — Fabric automation logs covering Hosted Exchange service delivery during December 2022 breach are material evidence; automation workflow state at time of breach relevant to understanding incident scope and remediation adequacy

name: Acquisition and Corporate Development Data
description: Due diligence records and integration data from strategic acquisitions including Datapipe Parent, Inc. (2017 acquisition by Rackspace Hosting via Inception Parent) and Just Analytics Pte. Ltd. (acquired January 2022 for data analytics capabilities), along with Apollo Global Management ownership structure and affiliated entity transaction records.

retention_policy.minimum_retention: Permanent for acquisition transaction records; 7 years for due diligence workpapers
retention_policy.minimum_retention_basis: Delaware corporate law — merger and acquisition records permanently retained; SOX Section 802 — acquisition financial records 7 years; IRS § 338 election records — retained for life of acquired assets plus 7 years; SEC disclosure records for material acquisitions: 7 years; Apollo Global Management portfolio management reporting requirements
retention_policy.maximum_retention: Permanent for Datapipe (2017) and Just Analytics (2022) acquisition closing documents; 7 years for integration financial records; Apollo ownership structure records: permanent while ownership continues; due diligence materials: 7 years post-integration completion
retention_policy.maximum_retention_basis: Delaware corporate law permanent records for fundamental corporate transactions; SOX 7-year financial record requirement; IRS stepped-up basis calculations require acquisition records for asset life; GDPR compliance for personal data of acquired company employees transferred in deal (data transferred under legitimate interest)
retention_policy.destruction_method: No destruction for permanent acquisition records; due diligence workpapers destruction per 7-year schedule requires CFO and GC approval; Apollo-related transaction records require board approval for destruction; M&A counsel sign-off for privileged due diligence materials
retention_policy.legal_hold_status: None standard; Apollo LBO acquisition records (2016) and refinancing (March 2024) under ongoing financial review; Just Analytics integration records may be relevant to future SEC disclosure obligations

name: Restructuring and Transformation Data
description: July 2021 Restructuring Plan execution data, January 2023 segment reorganization records (Public Cloud and Private Cloud business unit formation), workforce reduction documentation, real estate portfolio optimization records (including San Antonio corporate headquarters lease termination), and cost optimization tracking data.

retention_policy.minimum_retention: 7 years for workforce reduction and restructuring financial records
retention_policy.minimum_retention_basis: WARN Act (29 U.S.C. § 2101) — employer records for layoffs 3 years minimum; FLSA — employment records 3 years; SOX Section 802 — restructuring financial records 7 years; ERISA — benefit plan records related to terminations 6 years; GDPR Article 17 — employee PII from terminated personnel processed per legitimate interest (legal obligation basis)
retention_policy.maximum_retention: 7 years for restructuring financial records and segment reorganization documentation; workforce reduction records (severance, WARN notices): 7 years post-termination; real estate lease termination: 7 years post-expiration; cost optimization tracking: 7 years (SOX audit trail for reported cost savings)
retention_policy.maximum_retention_basis: SOX 7-year requirement for restructuring charges and reorganization financials; employment law defense requires records for any terminated employee claims (7-year prudent retention); Apollo Global Management reporting obligations for portfolio company restructuring; SEC disclosure supporting data for material restructuring charges reported in financial statements
retention_policy.destruction_method: Workforce records destruction per HR records management schedule with Legal sign-off; GDPR erasure requests for EU employees balanced against legitimate interest for legal defense; financial restructuring records destruction requires CFO and GC authorization; real estate records destruction per property management retention schedule
retention_policy.legal_hold_status: Active — January 2023 workforce reduction records are subject to EEOC/ADEA charge risk and any pending employment discrimination claims; segment reorganization documentation relevant to SEC disclosure obligations; July 2021 restructuring records subject to securities litigation hold for financial reporting accuracy

name: UK Public Services Network Data
description: PSN compliance assessment records and government-grade connectivity data for UK public sector customers, including PSN Code of Connection compliance evidence and data processed within UK-based facilities to support UK government agency workloads.

retention_policy.minimum_retention: 3 years for PSN CoCo compliance evidence; duration of contract for government workload data
retention_policy.minimum_retention_basis: NCSC PSN Code of Connection — compliance assessment records retained 3 years for annual renewal cycle; UK DPA 2018 / UK GDPR Article 30 — records of processing for government contracts; UK government data: per Data Processing Agreement under UK GDPR; Cyber Essentials Plus certification evidence: annual cycle
retention_policy.maximum_retention: 3 years for PSN CoCo assessment records; government workload data: per contract plus 3 years; UK GDPR data subject records: duration of processing plus 3 years; PSN compliance reports: 3 years per NCSC guidance
retention_policy.maximum_retention_basis: UK GDPR accountability principle (Article 5(2)); NCSC PSN annual assessment renewal documentation requirements; UK government contract standard terms (G-Cloud framework) for data retention; Rackspace Limited (UK entity) data controller obligations under ICO registration
retention_policy.destruction_method: NIST 800-88 secure deletion for UK government data; PSN-compliant media destruction for decommissioned UK-facility equipment; UK GDPR erasure requests coordinated through Rackspace Limited EU/UK representative; NCSC-approved destruction procedures for highly classified residue
retention_policy.legal_hold_status: None — UK PSN data is not implicated in December 2022 breach (breach affected US Hosted Exchange); standard UK government contract retention applies

name: IRAP-Assessed Data
description: Information Security Registered Assessors Program assessment records and Australian government workload data processed within IRAP-assessed Rackspace environments, supporting Australian federal and state government customer compliance requirements.

retention_policy.minimum_retention: 3 years for IRAP assessment records; duration of contract for Australian government workload data
retention_policy.minimum_retention_basis: Australian Government Information Security Manual (ISM) — security assessment records 7 years; Privacy Act 1988 (Cth) Australian Privacy Principle 11 — destruction/de-identification when no longer needed for primary purpose; ASD IRAP assessor program requirements — assessment evidence retained for re-assessment cycle; Australian government contract terms
retention_policy.maximum_retention: 7 years for IRAP assessment reports and security architecture documentation (ISM requirement); Australian government workload data: contract term plus 3 years; Privacy Act APP 11 compliance records: 5 years; Protective Security Policy Framework (PSPF) compliance evidence: 5 years
retention_policy.maximum_retention_basis: Australian ISM Control ISM-1551 — information security documentation retention; PSPF Governance 4 — security assessment record retention; ASD Essential 8 maturity assessment records; Australian government data sovereignty requirements mandate onshore retention for some data classifications
retention_policy.destruction_method: ASD-approved media destruction for Australian government data; ISM-compliant secure deletion procedures; Privacy Act APP 11.2 — destruction or de-identification when no longer required; IRAP assessment reports destruction requires Rackspace APJ VP and IRAP assessor notification; Australian data sovereignty requirements prohibit offshore transfer of some classified materials
retention_policy.legal_hold_status: None — Australian government IRAP-assessed environments not implicated in December 2022 breach; standard government contract retention applies

name: Cloud Usage Metering and Billing Data
description: Consumption-based usage metering events published through the Rackspace Cloud Feeds API (Atom syndication), including per-service usage records for Cloud Servers (nova), Cloud Databases (dbaas), Cloud Files (object storage), Cloud Block Storage, Cloud Load Balancers, Cloud Queues, Cloud Monitoring (MaaS), Cloud DNS, Cloud CDN, and Cloud Backup, with bandwidth metrics (PublicNet, ServiceNet), aggregated by Usage Mediation Services (UMS) for Billing and Revenue Management (BRM) invoice generation.

retention_policy.minimum_retention: 7 years
retention_policy.minimum_retention_basis: SOX Section 802 (financial records); IRS/IRC § 6001 (7-year audit period for revenue records)
retention_policy.maximum_retention: 10 years
retention_policy.maximum_retention_basis: Apollo LBO transaction records; FCPA/OFAC recordkeeping; internal policy post-litigation
retention_policy.destruction_method: Secure Deletion (NIST 800-88 Rev.1 Purge); AES-256 cryptographic erasure for cloud-hosted tiers
retention_policy.legal_hold_status: Active — Apollo LBO Financial Due Diligence / SEC Investigation (2023)

name: Cloud Feeds Audit and Event Data
description: CADF-standard (Cloud Auditing Data Federation) user access events capturing all API calls against Rackspace cloud services, including initiator identity, target service, action type, outcome status, request/response metadata, and regionalized event streams (DFW, ORD, IAD, LON, SYD, HKG) published as Atom entries with tenant, region, and data center categorization.

retention_policy.minimum_retention: 1 year
retention_policy.minimum_retention_basis: PCI DSS v4.0 Req. 10.7.1 (audit log retention); FedRAMP JAB Moderate AU-11 (1 year online)
retention_policy.maximum_retention: 3 years
retention_policy.maximum_retention_basis: FedRAMP PMO guidance (3-year audit record retention); NIST SP 800-92 log management
retention_policy.destruction_method: Secure Deletion (NIST 800-88 Rev.1 Purge); AES-256 cryptographic erasure
retention_policy.legal_hold_status: Active — December 2022 Play Ransomware Breach Litigation (CADF audit events are primary forensic evidence)

name: Cloud Monitoring Telemetry Data
description: Monitoring-as-a-Service (MaaS) telemetry from remote monitoring checks (HTTP, TCP, PING across global monitoring zones) and agent-based monitoring checks (CPU, memory, disk, filesystem, network), including alarm state data, notification plan configurations, check metrics time-series, and suppression records managed through the Rackspace Monitoring API.

retention_policy.minimum_retention: 1 year
retention_policy.minimum_retention_basis: FedRAMP JAB Moderate AU-11 (audit and monitoring records); PCI DSS v4.0 Req. 10.7.1
retention_policy.maximum_retention: 3 years
retention_policy.maximum_retention_basis: FedRAMP PMO 3-year retention guidance; operational SLA evidence for breach-period SLO disputes
retention_policy.destruction_method: Secure Deletion (NIST 800-88 Rev.1 Purge); time-series data purge via retention policies in monitoring platform
retention_policy.legal_hold_status: Active — December 2022 Breach Investigation (monitoring alarm/check data from breach period preserved as evidence)

name: Cloud Object Storage and CDN Data
description: Cloud Files container and object metadata, access control lists, content delivery network (CDN) configurations including TTL settings, SSL certificate associations, origin definitions, and caching rule data managed through both the Cloud Files Storage API and the dedicated Rackspace CDN API with Akamai edge network integration.

retention_policy.minimum_retention: 3 years
retention_policy.minimum_retention_basis: FedRAMP JAB Moderate CM-3 (configuration management records); DFARS 252.204-7012 (3-year minimum for cloud service records)
retention_policy.maximum_retention: 7 years
retention_policy.maximum_retention_basis: Akamai CDN contractual records; customer contract terms requiring post-termination data retention
retention_policy.destruction_method: Secure Deletion (NIST 800-88 Rev.1 Purge); AES-256 cryptographic erasure for object metadata
retention_policy.legal_hold_status: Active — December 2022 Breach Investigation (object storage ACL and access configurations are forensic evidence)

name: Customer Identity and Authentication Data
description: Rackspace Cloud Identity v2.0 service data including user accounts, API key credentials, authentication tokens, role assignments, tenant-to-user mappings, identity federation configurations (SAML attribute mappings, IdP metadata), and multi-factor authentication enrollment records managed through the Customer Identity API.

retention_policy.minimum_retention: Account lifecycle + 3 years
retention_policy.minimum_retention_basis: GDPR Article 5(1)(e) storage limitation; CCPA § 1798.100 (retain while account active + dispute period); FedRAMP IA-4 identifier management
retention_policy.maximum_retention: Account lifecycle + 7 years
retention_policy.maximum_retention_basis: GDPR data subject rights dispute window; SOX internal control evidence; litigation hold extension
retention_policy.destruction_method: Cryptographic Erasure (AES-256 key destruction for token data); Secure Deletion (NIST 800-88 Rev.1) for credential stores
retention_policy.legal_hold_status: Active — December 2022 Play Ransomware Breach (IAM/identity data is primary evidence; credential compromise was the attack vector)

name: Customer Management and Offer Data
description: Customer account lifecycle data managed through the Rackspace Customer Management Service API v4.24.0, including account creation, account status transitions, service entitlements, and product offer catalog data from the Rackspace Offer API v2.0 defining available service configurations, pricing tiers, and regional availability.

retention_policy.minimum_retention: 7 years
retention_policy.minimum_retention_basis: SOX Section 802 (customer financial records supporting revenue recognition); IRS/IRC § 6001; GDPR Art. 6(1)(b) contract performance basis
retention_policy.maximum_retention: 10 years
retention_policy.maximum_retention_basis: Apollo LBO customer base valuation records; offer catalog pricing history as competitive trade secret; litigation hold extension
retention_policy.destruction_method: Secure Deletion (NIST 800-88 Rev.1 Purge); AES-256 cryptographic erasure for PII fields
retention_policy.legal_hold_status: Active — December 2022 Breach Litigation (affected customer account records); Apollo LBO Due Diligence

name: Ticketing and Support Interaction Data
description: Customer support ticket records managed through the Rackspace Ticketing API v2.0 (CTAPI), including ticket creation, status updates, priority classifications, assigned team metadata, resolution timestamps, and customer communication threads supporting the Fanatical Experience service model.

retention_policy.minimum_retention: 3 years
retention_policy.minimum_retention_basis: GDPR Article 6(1)(b) contract performance basis; CCPA § 1798.100; FedRAMP SA-9 (service provider records)
retention_policy.maximum_retention: 7 years
retention_policy.maximum_retention_basis: Customer contract dispute resolution window; Fanatical Experience SLA evidence; litigation hold extension for breach-period tickets
retention_policy.destruction_method: Secure Deletion (NIST 800-88 Rev.1 Purge); PII fields anonymized prior to archival
retention_policy.legal_hold_status: Active — December 2022 Play Ransomware Breach Litigation (breach-period support tickets and customer communications are key evidence)

name: Cloud Orchestration and Infrastructure-as-Code Data
description: Heat orchestration stack templates, resource dependency graphs, stack event logs, and infrastructure provisioning state data managed through the Cloud Orchestration API v1.0, plus Terraform module configurations from the rackspace-infrastructure-automation GitHub organization for AWS, GCP, and multi-cloud infrastructure deployments.

retention_policy.minimum_retention: 3 years
retention_policy.minimum_retention_basis: FedRAMP JAB Moderate CM-3/CM-6 (configuration management records); DFARS 252.204-7012 (3-year minimum for cloud infrastructure records)
retention_policy.maximum_retention: 7 years
retention_policy.maximum_retention_basis: Proprietary IaC templates as trade secrets; infrastructure state at breach time as litigation evidence; internal IP protection policy
retention_policy.destruction_method: Secure Deletion (NIST 800-88 Rev.1 Purge); version-controlled deletion from GitHub with cryptographic confirmation
retention_policy.legal_hold_status: Active — December 2022 Breach Investigation (infrastructure state and orchestration configs at breach time are forensic evidence)

name: Rackspace Metrics Time-Series Data
description: Time-series performance metrics ingested and queried through the Rackspace Metrics API v2.0, including infrastructure performance data points (CPU utilization, memory consumption, disk I/O, network throughput), application performance metrics, and custom telemetry with configurable retention periods and aggregation functions.

retention_policy.minimum_retention: 1 year
retention_policy.minimum_retention_basis: FedRAMP JAB Moderate AU-11 / SI-4 (performance monitoring records); PCI DSS v4.0 Req. 10.7.1
retention_policy.maximum_retention: 3 years
retention_policy.maximum_retention_basis: FedRAMP PMO 3-year retention; operational SLA baseline and capacity planning evidence
retention_policy.destruction_method: Secure Deletion (NIST 800-88 Rev.1 Purge); automated time-series expiration via retention window in metrics platform
retention_policy.legal_hold_status: Active — December 2022 Breach Investigation (performance baseline metrics from breach period preserved as forensic and SLA evidence)

name: Load Balancer Configuration and Traffic Data
description: Dedicated and cloud load balancer configurations managed through Load Balancers API v3.0 (DLBv3) and Cloud Load Balancers API v1.0, including virtual IP assignments, backend node pools, health monitor definitions, SSL termination certificates, connection logging data, and traffic distribution algorithm configurations.

retention_policy.minimum_retention: 3 years
retention_policy.minimum_retention_basis: FedRAMP JAB Moderate CM-3/SC-7 (network configuration records); DFARS 252.204-7012 (3-year minimum)
retention_policy.maximum_retention: 7 years
retention_policy.maximum_retention_basis: Proprietary traffic distribution algorithms and LB architecture as trade secrets; SSL certificate chain records; litigation hold extension
retention_policy.destruction_method: Secure Deletion (NIST 800-88 Rev.1 Purge); certificate material via cryptographic erasure
retention_policy.legal_hold_status: Active — December 2022 Breach Investigation (LB and network configs at breach time are forensic evidence of attack path)

name: Rackspace Inheritable Security Controls Data
description: FedRAMP-authorized Rackspace Inheritable Security Controls (RISC) platform data powered by Xacta, including control implementation statements for approximately 80% of FedRAMP Moderate requirements, control inheritance documentation, continuous monitoring evidence, and customer ATO acceleration package data for ISVs and systems integrators serving more than half of federal cabinet agencies.

retention_policy.minimum_retention: 3 years
retention_policy.minimum_retention_basis: FedRAMP PMO continuous monitoring requirements; NIST SP 800-137 (3-year ConMon evidence retention); FISMA reporting obligations
retention_policy.maximum_retention: 7 years
retention_policy.maximum_retention_basis: Proprietary control inheritance methodology as trade secret; ATO package evidence for customer regulatory defense; litigation hold extension post-breach
retention_policy.destruction_method: Secure Deletion (NIST 800-88 Rev.1 Purge); Xacta platform data purge per decommission procedure
retention_policy.legal_hold_status: Active — December 2022 Breach Litigation (FedRAMP ConMon evidence from breach period relevant to regulatory inquiry and customer ATO defense)

name: Open-Source Platform and Community Data
description: Source code repositories, issue trackers, pull request data, and community contribution records across seven GitHub organizations (rackspace, racker, rackerlabs, rackspace-infrastructure-automation, Rackspace-DOT, rackspace-orchestration-templates, racksec), including OpenStack contributions (Genestack, Understack for Ironic bare metal), security tools (Scantron distributed nmap scanning), and API middleware (Repose).

retention_policy.minimum_retention: Indefinite (active repos); 7 years post-archive
retention_policy.minimum_retention_basis: GDPR Art. 6(1)(b) for contributor records; open-source license obligations (Apache 2.0, MIT); commit history integrity requirements
retention_policy.maximum_retention: Indefinite for public OSS repos
